text.div:
SHR QualitativeLikelihoodCS CodeSystem

The likelihood of an event or state, expressed qualitatively. Qualitative likelihoods are associated with judgments and assessments. Values are based on US Intelligence Community's standard language used to describe judgements of likelihood.

name: SHR QualitativeLikelihoodCS CodeSystem
title: SHR QualitativeLikelihoodCS CodeSystem
publisher: The MITRE Corporation: Standard Health Record Collaborative
description: The likelihood of an event or state, expressed qualitatively. Qualitative likelihoods are associated with judgments and assessments. Values are based on US Intelligence Community's standard language used to describe judgements of likelihood.

concept.display: With certainty or near-complete certainty, an event that definitely has or almost certainly will happen
concept.definition: With certainty or near-complete certainty, an event that definitely has or almost certainly will happen

concept.display: Very likely, highly probable, e.g., an event with more than 80% but less than 100% likelihood
concept.definition: Very likely, highly probable, e.g., an event with more than 80% but less than 100% likelihood

concept.display: Likely or probable, e.g., an event with 60% to 80% likelihood
concept.definition: Likely or probable, e.g., an event with 60% to 80% likelihood

concept.display: Roughly equal chance or even odds of happening, between 40% and 60% probability
concept.definition: Roughly equal chance or even odds of happening, between 40% and 60% probability

concept.display: Not likely or improbable, e.g., an event with 20% to 40% likelihood
concept.definition: Not likely or improbable, e.g., an event with 20% to 40% likelihood

concept.display: Very unlikely, highly improbable, e.g., an event with less than 20% but non-zero likelihood
concept.definition: Very unlikely, highly improbable, e.g., an event with less than 20% but non-zero likelihood
